resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: The moon represents the feminine principle. The union of these two opposing forces represents  harmony and balance necessary for progress in the alchemical process.
resource.chars: The moon represents the feminine principle. The union of these two opposing forces represents  harmony and balance necessary for progress in the alchemical process.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: The solar-lunar couple is one of the most iconic alchemical pairs. The sun represents the masculine principle.
resource.chars: The solar-lunar couple is one of the most iconic alchemical pairs. The sun represents the masculine principle.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: The serpent and eagle represent opposing forces in alchemy. The serpent, linked to the earth, symbolizes matter.
resource.chars: The serpent and eagle represent opposing forces in alchemy. The serpent, linked to the earth, symbolizes matter.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Symbol of the god Mercury (Hermes), representing a caduceus. It also symbolizes the liquid metal named after the god. Alchemists considered mercury as a representation of the prima materia, the initial formless and chaotic substance from which transformation begins.
resource.chars: Symbol of the god Mercury (Hermes), representing a caduceus. It also symbolizes the liquid metal named after the god. Alchemists considered mercury as a representation of the prima materia, the initial formless and chaotic substance from which transformation begins.

item.value: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" d="M721.06475,245.07077h20.54545v0h20.54545v21.45455v21.45455h-20.54545h-20.54545v-21.45455z" data-paper-data="{"strokeWidth":1,"rotation":0,"deleteIcon":null,"rotationIcon":null,"group":null,"editable":true,"annotation":null}" id="rectangle_355758b5-5b01-4d95-981c-42af81ffe407" fill-opacity="0" fill="#00bfff" fill-rule="nonzero" stroke="#00bfff" stroke-width="1" stroke-linecap="butt" stroke-linejoin="miter" stroke-miterlimit="10" stroke-dasharray="" stroke-dashoffset="0" font-family="none" font-weight="none" font-size="none" text-anchor="none" style="mix-blend-mode: normal"/></svg>

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: The god Hermes (or Mercury), often associated with the principle of transformation. He symbolizes the alchemist's ability to convert the base matter (prima materia) into a purer and higher form. He embodies the alchemical process of transmutation.
resource.chars: The god Hermes (or Mercury), often associated with the principle of transformation. He symbolizes the alchemist's ability to convert the base matter (prima materia) into a purer and higher form. He embodies the alchemical process of transmutation.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: The eagle, associated with air, represents the spirit. Its union (or opposition) with the serpent symbolizes transcending material constraints to reach higher levels of consciousness.
resource.chars: The eagle, associated with air, represents the spirit. Its union (or opposition) with the serpent symbolizes transcending material constraints to reach higher levels of consciousness.
